meanings.definition: To add too much spice to something.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally overspiced the soup, making it too spicy to eat.
meanings.sent2: I always overspice my chili because I love the extra kick.
meanings.sent3: The chef overspiced the curry so much that even the fire alarm started sweating.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter overspiced the room with joy, filling it with warmth and happiness.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of overspicing lingered in the kitchen, tempting everyone to try the flavorful dish.

meanings.definition: The act of adding an excessive amount of spice to a dish.
meanings.sent1: His overspicing of the stew ruined the balance of flavors.
meanings.sent2: The overspicing in the sauce was evident from the first bite.
meanings.sent3: The overspicing in the casserole turned it into a spicy surprise.
meanings.sent4: The overspicing of the dish created a fiery explosion of taste in my mouth.
meanings.sent5: The overspicing of the curry transformed it into a spicy masterpiece.
